name: Contact
description: The Contact class describes contact information for organizations and personnel involved in the incident.  This class allows for the naming of the involved party, specifying contact information for them, and identifying their role in the incident.

ContactName.name: ContactName
ContactName.description: The name of the contact.  The contact may either be an organization or a person.  The type attribute disambiguates the semantics.

Description.name: Description
Description.description: A free-form description of this contact.  In the case of a person, this is often the organizational title of the individual.

RegistryHandle.name: RegistryHandle
RegistryHandle.description: A handle name into the registry of the contact.

PostalAddress.name: PostalAddress
PostalAddress.description: The postal address of the contact.

Email.name: Email
Email.description: The email address of the contact.

Telephone.name: Telephone
Telephone.description: The telephone number of the contact.

Fax.name: Fax
Fax.description: The facsimile telephone number of the contact.

Timezone.name: Timezone
Timezone.description: The timezone in which the contact resides formatted according to Section 2.9.

Contact.name: Contact
Contact.description: A Contact instance contained within another Contact instance inherits the values of the parent(s).  This recursive definition can be used to group common data pertaining to multiple points of contact and is especially useful when listing multiple contacts at the same organization.

AdditionalData.name: AdditionalData
AdditionalData.description: A mechanism by which to extend the data model.

role.name: role
role.description: Indicates the role the contact fulfills.  This attribute is defined as an enumerated list:

ext-role.name: ext-role
ext-role.description: A means by which to extend the role attribute. See Section 5.1.

type.name: type
type.description: Indicates the type of contact being described. This attribute is defined as an enumerated list:

ext-type.name: ext-type
ext-type.description: A means by which to extend the type attribute. See Section 5.1.

restriction.name: restriction
restriction.description: This attribute is defined in Section 3.2.
